paper.title: Public and Private Equity Returns: Different or Same?
paper.abstract: In this article, the authors propose a novel, Shiller-inspired, regression- style model that links observed private and public equity returns. The model illuminates why, over the short term, private returns are superior to public ones, whereas over the long term, public and private returns are largely interchangeable after proper adjustments are made, resolving a long-standing conundrum. Results are interpreted qualitatively and further supported by the analysis of volatility and correlation term structures for both private and public equity assets. Finally, the authors make suggestions on how to incorporate findings into comparative analysis of private equity funds and, more generally, into multi-asset portfolio constructions.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究公共和私人股权回报之间的关系，并建议如何将这些发现纳入多资产投资组合构建中，这直接涉及投资组合管理的领域。
